body.p: Match each characteristic to either the pulmonary circulation, systemic circulation, or both.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although the pulmonary circulation contains capillary networks for the exchange of gasses, the systemic circulation also participates in exchange.

Correct. The pulmonary circulation is found in the thoracic cavity along with the heart, making the distance blood has to travel much shorter than most of the pathways found in the systemic circulation.
Incorrect. The pulmonary arteries carry oxygen-poor blood from the heart to the pulmonary capillary beds.

part.hint: Consider the distance of the pulmonary circulation from the heart.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although the systemic circulation contains capillary networks for the exchange of gasses and nutrients, the pulmonary circulation also participates in exchange.

Incorrect. The pulmonary circulation is found in the thoracic cavity along with the heart, making the distance blood has to travel much shorter than most of the pathways found in the systemic circulation.
Correct. The arteries of the systemic circulation carry oxygen-rich blood from the heart to the systemic capillary beds.

part.hint: The systemic circulation delivers blood from the heart to organs and tissues.

response.feedback: Correct. Gas exchange occurs in the capillaries of the pulmonary circulation while gas and nutrient exchange occurs in the capillaries of the systemic circulation.
Incorrect. One of these circulations is found in the thoracic cavity along with the heart, making its pathways for blood flow much shorter than in the other pathway.
Incorrect. One of these circulations carries oxygen-rich blood in their arterial circulation whereas the other carries oxygen-poor blood.

part.hint: Circulation means “the continuous motion by which blood travels through all parts of the body under the action of the heart.”
